title: Warriors of the Deep
dialogue_triumphs: I sometimes wonder why I like the people of this miserable planet so much
There should have been another way.
dialogue_disasters: You'll get no help from me, "Silurian"!
goofs: In episode one, Icthar's (human) eyes are visible, blinking through the costume.
In episode three, the 'Silurians' are clearly wearing T-shirts under their neck sections.
Tegan decides to put on a bra between episodes one and two.
Dr Solow's karate chop seems a bit optimistic.
The Doctor leaves the TARDIS unlocked in his haste to explore.
Vorshak's stoic reaction to being shot.
Missile Command on the BBC Micro.
The Myrka's poor design and execution.

continuity_notes.name: Silurians
continuity_notes.description: Ancient reptilian race, now referring to themselves by the human-given name. Led by Icthar, sole survivor of the noble Silurian Triad.
continuity_notes.current_status: Awakened from hibernation, seeking to reclaim Earth

continuity_notes.name: Sea Devils
continuity_notes.description: Aquatic cousins of the Silurians, allied with them in this story.
continuity_notes.current_status: Awakened to aid Silurians, wearing laser-proof armor and carrying cutting devices

continuity_notes.name: Hexachromite gas
continuity_notes.description: Chemical compound lethal to marine and reptile life, including Silurians and Sea Devils.
continuity_notes.current_status: Used as a plot device and weapon

continuity_notes.name: Turlough
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's companion, skilled with firearms and electronics.
continuity_notes.current_status: Traveling with the Doctor to learn more

continuity_notes.name: Tegan
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's companion, interested in Earth's future.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine, capable of short-range 'hops' using a materialisation flip-flop.
continuity_notes.current_status: Functional, used to reach the sea base

roots: Dr No (guard costume design, the reactor pool)

locations.name: Earth's sea bed
locations.description: Underwater location where much of the story takes place
locations.current_status: Site of conflict between humans and reptilian species

locations.name: Earth orbit
locations.description: Space around Earth, featuring orbital weaponry
locations.current_status: Militarized zone in cold war between two power blocks

future_history: In 2084, Earth is divided into two power blocks engaged in a cold war. They regularly use orbital weaponry.
untold_adventures: The Doctor's previous encounter with Icthar and the Silurians, involving Silurian battle cruisers and the Myrka
additional_notes: The episode features notable costume and set design issues, including visible T-shirts under Silurian costumes and polystyrene doors. The use of eye make-up at the military base is noted as a fashion choice.
bottom_line: A great script with outstanding performance by Peter Davison, marred by design and continuity issues. The Doctor's radical actions and the powerful final line are highlights.
